SEARCH
Package civitas.celestis.math.complex

Class Quaternion

java.lang.Object
civitas.celestis.math.vector.Vector4
civitas.celestis.math.complex.Quaternion
All Implemented Interfaces:
Numeric, Vector, Serializable
public class Quaternion extends Vector4
A subclass of Vector4. Like Vector4, this is also immutable. A quaternion is used to represent the rotation of a Vector3.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Field Details

    • IDENTITY

      public static final Quaternion IDENTITY
      The identity quaternion. In the context of rotation quaternions, this represents no rotation.

  • Constructor Details

    • Quaternion

      public Quaternion(double w, double x, double y, double z)
      Creates a new quaternion.
      Parameters:
      w - The W component of this quaternion
      x - The X component of this quaternion
      y - The Y component of this quaternion
      z - The Z component of this quaternion

    • Quaternion

      public Quaternion(double s, @Nonnull Vector3 v)
      Creates a new quaternion.
      Parameters:
      s - The scalar part of this quaternion
      v - The vector part of this quaternion

  • Method Details

    • random

      @Nonnull public static Quaternion random()
      Returns a random unit quaternion. (rotation quaternion)
      Returns:
      A random unit quaternion

    • vector

      @Nonnull public final Vector3 vector()
      Returns the vector part of this quaternion.
      Returns:
      A Vector3 constructed from the components x, y, z.

    • axis

      @Nonnull public Vector3 axis()
      Given that this quaternion is a rotation quaternion (a quaternion with a magnitude of 1), this returns the axis of the rotation.
      Returns:
      The axis of the rotation

    • angle

      public double angle()
      Given that this quaternion is a rotation quaternion (a quaternion with a magnitude of 1), this returns the angle of the rotation in radians. The angle follows the right-hand-rule.
      Returns:
      The angle of the rotation

    • pitch

      public double pitch()
      Given that this quaternion is a rotation quaternion (a quaternion with a magnitude of 1), this returns the angle of pitch of this rotation in radians. Pitch is defined as counter-clockwise rotation around the X axis.
      Returns:
      The angle of rotation along the X axis in radians

    • yaw

      public double yaw()
      Given that this quaternion is a rotation quaternion (a quaternion with a magnitude of 1), this returns the angle of yaw of this rotation in radians. Yaw is defined as counter-clockwise rotation around the Y axis.
      Returns:
      The angle of rotation along the Y axis in radians

    • roll

      public double roll()
      Given that this quaternion is a rotation quaternion (a quaternion with a magnitude of 1), this returns the angle of roll of this rotation in radians. Roll is defined as counter-clockwise rotation around the Z axis.
      Returns:
      The angle of rotation along the Z axis in radians

    • scale

      @Nonnull public Quaternion scale(double s)
      Given that this quaternion is a rotation quaternion (a quaternion with a magnitude of 1), this scales the rotation of this quaternion by the provided factor s.
      Parameters:
      s - The scale factor to apply to this rotation quaternion
      Returns:
      The scaled rotation quaternion

    • min

      @Nonnull public Quaternion min(@Nonnull Vector v) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns the minimum vector between this vector and the provided vector v. This is achieved by applying Math.min(double, double) to each component of the two vectors.
      Specified by:

      Overrides:

    • normalize

      @Nonnull public Quaternion normalize()
      Normalizes this quaternion into a unit quaternion. (a rotation quaternion) If normalization is not possible (the magnitude is zero), this will return IDENTITY.
      Specified by:
      normalize in interface Vector
      Overrides:
      normalize in class Vector4
      Returns:
      The normalized quaternion

    • negate

      @Nonnull public Quaternion negate()
      Negates this quaternion.
      Specified by:
      negate in interface Vector
      Overrides:
      negate in class Vector4
      Returns:
      The negation of this quaternion

    • conjugate

      @Nonnull public Quaternion conjugate()
      Returns the conjugate of this quaternion. For rotation quaternions, using this is preferred to inverse() as it is less computationally intensive and for rotation quaternions, the inverse is equal to the conjugate.
      Returns:
      The conjugate of this quaternion

    • inverse

      @Nonnull public Quaternion inverse() throws UnsupportedOperationException
      Returns the inverse of this quaternion.
      Returns:
      The inverse of this quaternion
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - When the quaternion's magnitude is exactly zero

    • parseQuaternion

      @Nonnull public static Quaternion parseQuaternion(@Nonnull String input) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Deserializes a string into a Quaternion.
      Parameters:
      input - The input to deserialize
      Returns:
      The parsed vector
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - When the format is invalid
      IllegalArgumentException - When at least one of the component scalars is non-finite
